event: The U.S. Constitution is ratified.
Charles Darwin publishes 'On the Origin of Species'.
End of the U.S. Civil War.
The first motion picture is released.
Albert Einstein publishes his theory of special relativity.
Titanic sinks.
Start of World War I.
End of World War I.
The 18th Amendment is ratified, establishing Prohibition in the U.S.
The 19th Amendment is ratified, granting women the right to vote in the U.S.
First television broadcast takes place.
Start of World War II.
Attack on Pearl Harbor.
End of World War II.
The United Nations is founded.
First nuclear bomb test takes place.
Korean War begins.
End of the Korean War.
Sputnik 1, the first artificial satellite, is launched by the Soviet Union.
Vietnam War begins.
The Civil Rights Act is signed into law by President Lyndon B. Johnson.
The Beatles appear on The Ed Sullivan Show, sparking the 'British Invasion'.
First man lands on the Moon.
The first Star Wars movie is released.
Fall of Saigon, marking the end of the Vietnam War.
The Berlin Wall falls.
The World Wide Web is invented.
The Soviet Union dissolves.
The Hubble Space Telescope is launched.
9/11 terrorist attacks on the U.S.
The first iPhone is released.
Brexit referendum leads to the U.K. leaving the EU.
First image of a black hole is released.
Apple releases the Vision Pro.
